column2: KANSAS DMV PRACTICE TEST
column4: Kansas
column6: KS

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. If one of your tires blows out while driving, you should:
column4: apply the brakes firmly and steer toward the right edge of the road.
column6: hold the steering wheel firmly, slow down, and steer smoothly.

column2: 2. This sign means:
column4: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
column6: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.

column2: 3. In a vehicle equipped with air bags a child under 12 years old should be placed:
column4: In the back seat.
column6: In either the front or back seat.

column2: 4. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.
column6: There are four stop signs at the intersection.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road
column6: Low shoulder

column2: 6. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 7. When you are angry or upset you should:
column4: drive fast to let off steam.
column6: take a few minutes to cool off before you drive.
column8: listen to loud music while driving.

column2: 8. Drivers should check their rearview mirrors:
column4: to see if a truck is in their blind spot.
column6: often to see how traffic is moving behind them.

column2: 9. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column4: Keeping your windows clean and clear.
column6: Replacing worn wiper blades.

column2: 10. Before stopping your vehicle on the roadway, drivers should:
column4: place their foot on the accelerator.
column6: check their mirrors for traffic.
column8: pump the brakes to check if they work properly.

column2: 11. When a school bus is picking up or dropping off children, you must:
column4: stop regardless of your direction of travel.
column6: slow down and pass the bus with caution.
column8: stop if you are driving in the same direction.

column2: 12. This sign means:
column4: If you are driving at 40 MPH or less you must stay in the right-hand lane
column6: Curve ahead, drive at 40 MPH ot more around the curve ahead
column8: Curve ahead, the recommended speed is 40 MPH or less

column2: 13. Driving at excessive speed:
column4: often leads to high-risk decision-making.
column6: improves your reaction time.
column8: does not increase the chance of a crash.

column2: 14. Hydroplaning is usually caused by:
column4: brake failure.
column6: sudden turns.

column2: 15. When driving on gravel roads:
column4: your tires do not have as much traction.
column6: you should keep your eyes moving.
column8: you should use cruise control to increase traction.

column2: 16. When you cannot see any farther than 100 feet ahead due to rain, snow, smoke, fog or blowing dust, you cannot safely drive faster than:
column4: 40 MPH
column6: 30 MPH

column2: 17. If a tire suddenly blows out while you are driving, you should:
column4: apply the brakes firmly.
column6: slow down gradually and brake lightly.

column2: 18. Don't be afraid to sound a sharp blast on your horn when:
column4: when a child is about to run into the street.
column6: another vehicle is in danger of hitting you.

column2: 19. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column4: Mirrors are useless.
column6: Mirrors need to be adjusted.
column8: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.

column2: 20. When you are facing a green light and there are pedestrians in the intersection:
column4: you have the right-of-way over pedestrians.
column6: you must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.
column8: you must signal your intention to cross the intersection at least 100 feet before yielding the right-of-way.

column2: 21. Parking is not allowed:
column4: in a tunnel.
column6: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

column2: 22. To reduce road rage, you should:
column4: talk on your cell phone while driving.
column6: always signal your intention when changing lanes.
column8: use your horn frequently to warn other drivers.

column2: 23. This sign means:
column4: U-turns are not allowed.
column6: Parking is not allowed.

column2: 24. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: sound the horn.
column6: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column8: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 25. While inside the roundabout, you should:
column4: remain in your lane until you are ready to exit.
column6: change lanes before you check for vehicles behind you.
column8: use your left turn signal if you are in position to exit now.
